name: Slow Cooker Pumpkin Turkey Chili
author: coffee_junkee
summary: An easy chili that's sure to please. I've made this for a Halloween party and a chili cook-off at work with great results!  It's a great base with lots of options to spice it up depending on the crowd you're cooking for! I usually put everything together in the morning and let it simmer all day; cooking time can be adjusted to fit your needs.
directions: Heat olive oil in a large soup pot over medium heat; brown turkey, stirring often, until crumbly and no longer, pink, about 10 minutes
Transfer turkey to a slow cooker and stir in onions, diced tomatoes, pumpkin, chili beans, black beans, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice, and chili powder
Set cooker to Low, cover, and cook until pumpkin is tender and has started to break apart, at least 3 hours
